text: You come to love not by finding the perfect person, but by seeing an imperfect person perfectly
author: Sam Keen

text: Sexiness wears thin after a while and beauty fades, but to be married to a man who makes you laugh every day, ah, now that's a real treat.
author: Joanne Woodward

text: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even heard, but must be felt with the heart
author: Helen Keller

text: When you realize you want to spend the rest of your life with somebody, you want the rest of your life to start as soon as possible.
author: Billy Crystal

text: The most important thing in life is to learn how to give out love, and to let it come in
author: Morrie Schwartz

text: Who, being loved, is poor?
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Love is totally nonsensical. But we have to keep doing it or else we're lost and love is dead, and humanity should just pack it in. Because love is the best thing we do.
author: Josh Radnor

text: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Have enough courage to trust love one more time and always one more time.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Sometimes two people have to fall apart to realize how much they need to fall back together.
author: Anonymous

text: Love alone can rekindle life.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

text: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person
author: Mignon McLaughlin

text: Love is a game that two can play and both can win.
author: Eva Gabor

text: To know when to go away and when to come closer is the key to any lasting relationship.
author: Doménico Cieri Estrada

text: Love doesn't make the world go around. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
author: Fraklin P. Jones

text: To get the full value of joy, you must have someone to divide it with.
author: Mark Twain

text: Souls tend to go back to who feels like home.
author: N.R. Heart

text: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

text: I love her, and it is the beginning of everything.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

text: In my opinion, the best thing you can do is find someone who loves you for exactly what you are. Good mood, bad mood, ugly, pretty, handsome, what have you.
author: J.K. Simmons

text: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Okay, life's a fact, people do fall in love, people do belong to each other, because that's the only chance anybody's got for real happiness.
author: George Peppard

text: It is better to love wisely, no doubt: but to love foolishly is better than not to be able to love at all.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

text: It is not time or opportunity that is to determine intimacy;—it is disposition alone. Seven years would be insufficient to make some people acquainted with each other, and seven days are more than enough for others.
author: Jane Austen

text: The greatest thing you'll ever learn is just to love and be loved in return.
author: Moulin Rouge
